welcome: ^Welcome! You're a full-time Uber driver trying to make ends meet.
^You have one week to try to make $1000. Can you do it?

c: ^In Easy mode, you live in San Francisco and have good bank credit.
^In Hard mode, you live in Sacramento and have bad bank credit.

day_1_start: ^You start bright and early on a Monday morning.
^Pretty soon, you get your first ride request, from someone called Chris.
day_1_locate_passenger: ^You arrive, but don't see anyone waiting for a ride. What do you do?

call_chris: ^He answers the phone. "I'll be right there! Just coming out now," he says.
chris_arrives: ^A few minutes later, a flustered man with a big backpack comes out of a nearby apartment and walk towards your car.
in_car: ^"That's me. Sorry about being late," he replies, as he gets in the car.

c: ^ You start driving. Chris checks his phone.
^"Yeah," Chris replies, brightening up. "Meeting up with a friend, and then we're driving to this amazing place a few hours away. Lemme tell ya..."

driving: ^Twenty minutes later, you arrive at his destination.

c: ^"Thanks! Sorry again for making you wait," he says as he gets out.
^Congratulations! You've just earned your first fare, for $16.

car_choice: ^You're going to be spending a lot of time in your car. What model did you lease?

c: ^The Prius is fuel efficient, getting up to 50 miles per gallon.

b: ^Your good credit rating means it only costs $
^Unfortunately, your poor credit means it costs $

c: ^The Dodge minivan qualifies for UberXL rides, which earn higher fares.

b: ^Your good credit rating means it only costs $

s0: ^To prepare for life as a professional driver, you also bought...

c: ^Unlimited data plan: Since you have to be constantly connected to the Uber app, this will save you from paying overage charges.
^: A phone mount lets you use your phone with one hand while keeping your eyes on the road. And you don't want to run out of batteries.
^: In case someone makes a mess in your car
^: You are, after all, technically running a business as an independent contracter.
^: You could go work out at the gym, but the main perk is having a place to shower and freshen up.

weekday_quest_message: ^ extra. You have until Friday May 26, 4 am"

b: ^You live in San Francisco, Uber's hometown.

day_1_sacramento: ^You live in Sacramento, where fares are a third less than in a bigger city like San Francisco. Do you drive 2 hours to work in SF instead?

go_to_sf: ^You keep the app on, and score a ride as you approach SF that takes you all the way into the city.

b: ^You check your phone as you arrive in SF.

day_1_sac_afternoon_in_sf: ^SF is a lot busier than Sacramento. It's pretty stressful driving here.

b: ^After driving for so long, you're starting to get hungry.
^Coming to SF was definitely the right decision. But after driving for so long, you're starting to get hungry.

c: ^ You grab a quick slice of pepperoni

day_1_sac_evening_in_sf_mount: ^You get back online just in time for the busy evening period.
day_1_sac_night_in_sf: ^It's getting late and you have a two hour drive to get back home.

keep_driving: ^You call home to say you won't be back for dinner, and keep driving.
gym: ^You take a shower at the gym. Feeling refresed, you keep driving.

stay_or_go: ^. At this rate, you're unlikely to make $1000 by the end of the week.

c: ^ There's still time to salvage today, you think.

sac_lunch: ^You like driving in a familiar town, especially since it means you can get lunch at your favourite burrito place.

c: ^ You head home, in time for dinner.
^ Things should pick up during rush hour and dinner time.
^ By this point, it doesn't really make sense to make the two-hour trip to SF. You decide to stay in Sacramento, regretting that you didn't go earlier.

keep_driving: ^You call home to say you won't be back for dinner, and keep driving.

gas_receipt: ^You stop to fill up your tank. Do you get a receipt?

c: ^You keep it in a folder for your expenses.

burgers: ^You get a trip request from a burger joint, and when you arrive the passengers have two juicy In-N-Out burgers that they are about to eat in the car.
^"The food can’t come in the car"

c: ^"Aww, come on," they say. "We'll be careful."
^," you say, as you cancel their ride.
^," you say. They get in the car.
^They get in the car and you start driving.

g-0: ^From the rear-view mirror, you see one of them take a bite, and some ketchup drips onto the seat."

c: ^ After your admonishment, they wipe the seat, but there's still a stain. They look unhappy at being called out.
^ They blithely continue eating. You can't stop thinking about the stain.

g-0: ^"They finish their burgers. The rest of the trip passes without incident."

dirty_car: ^What do you do about your dirty backseat?

c: ^ You pull over to clean the back seat. Before you start cleaning, a ride request comes in.
^You abandon the cleaning and go pick up the passenger. He's not impressed with the dirty backseat.
^ You put it out of your mind. Your next passenger is not too impressed with the dirty backseat.

day_2_evening: ^You get a message from your friend. A group of them are meeting up for dinner and asks if you want to join.

b: ^You deserve a break. You turn off the Uber app and go to dinner with your friends.
^You want to, but it'll take too long to get back to Sacramento. You eat dinner by yourself instead before calling it a day.

keep_working: ^Working is more important. You say you can't make it.

pebble_start: ^As you drive along the highway, a pebble hits your windshield and leaves a chip.

repair: ^You find a nearby auto shop. They take an hour to fix your windscreen, and charge you $30.

nice_passenger: ^You pick up a friendly passenger and have a pleasant chat during the ride.

g-0: ^Soon, you get a notification. She gave you an 'Excellent Service' badge!

c: ^ Nice! Your rating has gone up to

^She shouts as you as you pull away. Fortunately, the rest of the rides were short ones. You finish after two hours.
^You take her to the airport. You didn't want to get in the queue for a ride back, so you drive back to town by yourself. You decide to call it a day and finish the quest tomorrow instead.

day_5_evening: ^You've just dropped off a passenger in the Financial District in the northeast of San Francisco, when you notice there's surge pricing.

c: ^: You see there's 3x surge pricing in the Sunset district.

surge: ^The 3x fare is attractive, but it might be gone by the time you get to the Sunset district, which is 30 minutes away.

c: ^Tripling your earning is just too tempting. You start driving over to the surge zone, but the roads are busy and the traffic lights are not on your side tonight.

day_6_work: ^The San Francisco Giants are playing at AT&T park today. Earn a boosted 1.5x fare for trips from there, from 5pm-6:30pm today
door_dent: ^As you finish a ride, the passenger opens the door to get out and hits a lamp post, denting your car door. He is apologetic, but in a rush, and tells you to resolve it with Uber.

c: ^ Uber promises to investigate, but in the meantime your account is suspended. There's nothing else you can do today.
